committee.name: Aroha Williams
committee.bio: Final-year Computer Science student. Passionate about making AI accessible to students from all backgrounds across Aotearoa.

committee.name: James Nakamura
committee.bio: Studying Data Science and Statistics. Leads our workshop programme and ML reading group.

committee.name: Priya Sharma
committee.bio: Commerce and Computer Science double major. Manages sponsorships and keeps the books balanced.

committee.name: Ethan Cole
committee.bio: Engineering student with a focus on robotics and embedded AI systems. Handles communications and logistics.

committee.name: Dr. Marcus Lee
committee.bio: Lecturer in the School of Engineering and Computer Science. Research interests in NLP and AI fairness.

groups.name: Labs
groups.description: Collaborative AI research projects, reading groups, and paper discussions. We run semester-long projects and publish findings on GitHub.

groups.name: Education
groups.description: Workshops, tutorials, blog content, and learning resources. From intro Python to advanced ML — we create pathways for every skill level.

groups.name: Events
groups.description: Speaker events, industry panels, hackathons, and social gatherings. We bring the Wellington AI community together.

groups.name: Outreach & Diversity
groups.description: Community engagement, school visits, and inclusive programming. We believe AI should reflect everyone — not just the loudest voices in the room.

groups.name: Safety & Governance
groups.description: AI ethics discussions, responsible AI research, and policy engagement. Including work on Maori data sovereignty and AI governance in Aotearoa.
